descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will examine the rise and fall of piracy in the early modern Atlantic. No other band of outlaws can match the hold that pirates have on the popular imagination, from the "sea dogs" who prowled the Spanish Main to the fearsome exploits of Blackbeard. Setting piracy within the larger context of the Atlantic World, this course will explore the reasons why men, and occasionally women, risked their lives as buccaneers on the high seas. We will analyze the societies they sought to create, at sea and on land, grappling with themes of race, class, colonialism and rebellion. We will also consider our enduring fascination with pirates, from lurid contemporary newsletters to later legends of buried treasure, separating myth from reality in their time and our own.
